content:
The following instructions are for 64-bit Ubuntu.

Prepared by Prof. Chen Li.

- Install Java: 

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-java-with-apt-get-on-ubuntu-16-04

shell> sudo apt-get update
shell> sudo apt-get install default-jre
shell> sudo apt-get install default-jdk
shell> javac -version

- Install MySQL

https://help.ubuntu.com/community/JDBCAndMySQL

shell> sudo apt-get install mysql-server
shell> sudo apt-get install mysql-client
shell> sudo apt-get install libmysql-java

shell> mysql -u root -p

mysql> CREATE USER 'mytestuser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'mypassword';
mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON * . * TO 'mytestuser'@'localhost';

mysql> create database moviedb;
mysql> use moviedb;

mysql>  create table stars(
  	     id integer primary key,
             first_name varchar(50),
	     last_name varchar(50),
	     dob date,
	     photo_url varchar(200)
	     );
		 
mysql> INSERT INTO stars VALUES(755011, 'Arnold', 'Schwarzeneggar', '1947/07/30', 'http://www.imdb.com/gallery/granitz/2028/Events/2028/ArnoldSchw_Grani_1252920_400.jpg?path=pgallery&path_key=Schwarzenegger,%20Arnold');
		 
mysql> INSERT INTO stars VALUES(755017, 'Eddie', 'Murphy', '1961/04/03', 'http://www.imdb.com/gallery/granitz/2487/Events/2487/EddieMurph_Pimen_2724994_400.jpg?path=pgallery&path_key=Murphy,%20Eddie%20(I)');

mysql> select * from stars;
mysql> exit

shell> mysql -u mytestuser -p
mysql> use moviedb;
mysql> select * from stars;


- Open a new shell:

shell> CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:/usr/share/java/mysql.jar
shell> export CLASSPATH
shell> javac JDBC1.java
shell> java JDBC1
